meanings.definition: The act of closing something down, especially a business or operation.
meanings.sent1: The shutdown of the factory caused many employees to lose their jobs.
meanings.sent2: The government ordered a shutdown of all non-essential businesses during the pandemic.
meanings.sent3: The shutdown of the ice cream shop made the kids in the neighborhood very sad.
meanings.sent4: The shutdown of the highway due to construction caused a massive traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The sudden shutdown of the power plant left the city in darkness.

meanings.definition: A temporary stoppage of operations or services.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected shutdown of the train station delayed all the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The shutdown of the website for maintenance lasted for several hours.
meanings.sent3: The shutdown of the amusement park due to a thunderstorm disappointed many visitors.
meanings.sent4: The shutdown of the elevator for repairs forced everyone to take the stairs.
meanings.sent5: The shutdown of the water supply for repairs left the neighborhood without water for a day.

meanings.definition: To cease operations or activity, especially temporarily.
meanings.sent1: The company had to shutdown production due to a shortage of raw materials.
meanings.sent2: The school decided to shutdown classes for a week after a flu outbreak.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to shutdown the kitchen temporarily to clean up a spill.
meanings.sent4: The airline had to shutdown flights to certain destinations due to bad weather.
meanings.sent5: The city had to shutdown the park for maintenance during the summer.
